info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 11:01AM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
At 1101 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from near Johnson Lake Barrens Natural Area to 11 miles east of Rhinelander, or extending from 21 miles northwest of Eagle River to 11 miles east of Rhinelander, moving east at 50 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
The strong thunderstorm will be near... Eagle River and Johnson Lake Barrens Natural Area around 1105 AM CDT. Crandon, Phelps and Headwaters Wilderness around 1120 AM CDT. Kentuck Lake Campground and North Otter Creek Natural Area around 1125 AM CDT. Popple River around 1135 AM CDT. Tipler and Wisconsin Slough Natural Area around 1145 AM CDT. Fern and Whisker Lake Wilderness around 1155 AM CDT.
Other locations impacted by this strong thunderstorm include Clearwater Lake, Three Lakes, Upper Buckatabon Springs Natural Area, Starks, Sugar Camp, Star Lake, Conover, Gagen, Monico and Scott Lake-Shelp Lake Natural Area.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

parameter.value: A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT VILAS...WESTERN FLORENCE...FOREST AND EASTERN ONEIDA COUNTIES UNTIL NOON CDT
